THIS IS IMPORTANT, RIOT PLS YOU DON'T WEAR CROCS IN SURGERY THAT IS UNSANITARY

A lot of surgeons wear Crocs because they're on their feet all day and Crocs are (supposed to be) comfortable (also water-proof/easy to wash, for blood/urine/other bodily fluids. Surgery can be messy). They might wear booties over top, but they're also not sticking their feet in your body, so it's not a big deal

Source: Spent a year interning in the operating room at my local hospital

EDIT: I (and many others) have addressed this in subsequent comments, but because it keeps coming up; the Crocs worn in the OR typically do not contain holes. I suspect Riot modeled the Croc with holes because it is the most iconic Croc design, and they wanted the shoes to be recognizable moreso than 100% accurate.

Crocs with holes arent actually allowed in the OR. Because if a hypo or blade or something else sharp and possibly contaminated with AIDS or another infectious disease falls into the hole. You're fucked.

The crocs they wear don't have holes. Pretty sure riot wanted them to be more recognizable to the populace while still being accurate footwear for a surgeon.

Crocs are actually the shoes of choice in hospitals as they're on the inexpensive side and still very functional allowing them to be thrown away if there's a situation they can't be cleaned. Most don't wear the ones with the holes in them, but the point still stands. Good job to Riot for the small detail of healthcare attire!

{{champion:98}} is one of those champions that I feel was masterfully crafted to be a top laner with some of the coolest unnoticed interactions in the game IMHO. I doubt many people know that having your shield [W] up will reduce the cooldown of your passive by 2 seconds every auto attack instead of one. I am sad to see him go and I don't understand why he needed to be updated. Heavily under appreciated champion.

To clarify Spirit Blade idle behavior:

* Spawns next to you at game start and respawn
* Despawns on death
* Snaps to your position when using any global teleport (Shen ult, recall, Tahm ult, etc.)
* Snaps towards you (but still pretty far away) if you move very far from it (talking off-screen distances here--keeps Q cast times manageable without affecting on-screen play)
* Q turns it into a homing missile towards you, and it lands on the ground when it reaches you

Maybe I'm just a hater here, but I greatly dislike this rework. All I see is riot messing with perfectly functional, good champions. There are many dysfunctional champions with "generic," abilities that they could just as well work on, but they chose not to. What's more, they are adding in more and more spells with little to no counter play. Shen's new w and Tahms w, are prime examples of this. This new w, pretty much counters all adcs in the game, where as Tahms counters a heaping majority of single target cc. This is a worrying trend in my opinion.

Shen's kit was far from functional. Compared to modern picks his W was underpowered and barely did anything. His q was a damage spell with some utility that involved what a 20 hps heal? Both spells were underpowered and involved little to no mechanics.

http://champion.gg/champion/Shen/Top

9th highest win rate top. I don't even play top; I win with him frequently. What's more, being a champion low in mechanics is not a bad thing. It makes the champion easier to learn for new comers. 

The pros run this champ frequently, in both the support and top role, so I'm pretty sure he's still functional. The statistics behind the champ tell me the same thing.

Dear rioters, I  hope one of your reads this, simply for a brainstorming here.

I dislike the fact that this shen has ZERO reliable poke and ranged farm, or lifesteal/sustain. 
When you create overpowered champions like Ravioli in the top lane, shen is GARANTEED to lose lane almost always now, and if he does, he can't safely farm/poke anymore.
He will be reduced to begging for laning phase to finish (lose a tower) just to get some farm without getting fully bursted.

This also killed the marked/sustain that was very important to him.
Especially when his blade position is barely controllable, and relies mostly on aggressive positioning to get the blade on a pathway to proc its effects.

I think that his Q needed to have two parts (and mark my words, it will be fixed to this one day):
Q (first press): throws the blade towards a TARGETED enemy, but deals NO DAMAGE to champions. The blade lands behind the target. Mark all enemies it passes through them.
Q (second press) : SNAP the blade back towards you. If an enemy champion is hit by the returning blade, apply the Q stuff you posted here. IF the enemy CHAMPION was marked when hit by the blade, then apply the second part of the Q stuff you mentioned in this post AND allies gain X health on hit on marked enemies for Y seconds. (similar to the live shen's Q).


Why? Because shen needs sustain at least early game. You can apply part of the things i mentioned to his underwhelming passive instead of his Q btw. 
But I'm pointing this out after talking to some people who mastered shen.

Another thought would be to make the W move the blade to target location before applying dodge, but that would be very confusing for ori players.

RIP Shen... I will miss you....{{item:3151}} {{item:3070}} {{champion:98}} 



WHYYY RIOT.....WHY????????????{{item:3070}}
Why? Shen is great the way he is. I main him and this kinda upsets me.

This legitimately pisses me off as a Shen main.
I have 100k mastery with Shen, and I've been playing him frequently since S1.

The change to Q is going to push him out of toplane even more, on paper it might look like that Q+W is going to do something meaningful in trades - but it only blocks basic attacks, but that's not going to exclude empowered attacks or on hit effects as those will still go through from what I understand.

Here's the gist of it:
- Shen can't poke anymore
- Becomes a toplaner with a W that is situational and wont block any kind of damage like it used to, instead it blocks only basic attacks - and yeah it helps allies, ok... so what how does that help the laning phase as a top laner are we trying to push him into a support role?
- New passive means he deals less damage overall, as late game tanky shen could do a good chunk with a single, now he needs to hit multiple times to do damage consistently...
- Loss of sustain from Q in trades.

This doesn't seem like a fix to the champion, it seems like the next 'olafed' iteration courtesy of Riot games.  

With all the mobility creep in the current state of the game, he was in a rough spot as it is but you could make it work with the current Q & W.

Please Riot. I know you don't listen to your players when it comes to things like this, but i really dont want you to rework shen.

Shen's kit is simple **AND THAT'S OKAY!** Not every champion needs complicated mechanics or big playmaking moves. Not every champion needs to be interesting...

There has to be room for the "niche" champions - the simple champions who are always there when you need them. With simple mechanics and simple abilities, but a lot to offer - shen is a perfect example of this kind of champion. A targeted damage dealing ability with sustain, a small shield, a dash with some nice cc and an ultimate to help the team out. He doesnt need more...


Furthermore i think what you have done with his Q is absolutely disgusting. It is counter intuitive. That and he no longer has any sustain, which was a big part of shen for me... 
Oh, and surprise surprise - you gave him a fucking 3-hit passive.

If you absolutely had to change something about him, it should only be his W, but even then i feel it's too much.

Please Riot, stop changing champions we love and just make new ones instead.

RIP {{champion:98}} 
2010 - 2016

I can honestly say that I'm not a fan of this change. I feel like Shen's core mechanic was a tanky bruiser with a lot of sustain early game. The kit synergized really well--your passive cooled down faster by attacking things (doubly so with your shield up), you could trade when you used Q to harass, but you had the ability to farm minions as well.

The new Shen isn't going to have any of that. You're going to have a blade you need to keep track of which has a very long range. Your sustain is baked into your new passive--a shield that triggers on abilities. So that's nearly entirely pointless with your W (since you'll be immune to auto-attacks anyway). You are going to get more damage with the new Q, but if you were taking Shen on your team it's because you needed a brick with a taunt, not a damage threat. None of these abilities are going to give Shen any real staying power in lane.

I guess what I'm trying to say is that I liked Shen because he had great sustain in top-lane. I could out-last virtually any opponent and wear them down. Mid-game, I have the ability to make an engage or turn a skirmish around into a kill. Late-game, I'm a front-line force that's making engages or peeling effectively for my ADC. These changes seem like you're taking those core mechanics away, and replacing them with a ~~knock-off ball~~ spirit blade.
